title: Non-phone Mobile Hotspot for League
body: Okay so I am currently a student living on campus but the League servers wont connect so I am guessing it's something to do with the Blocking or etc. So I wanna know if i buy a mobile hotpot device, will it work and lemme play with minimal ping spikes? Ex: https://www.google.com/search?q=mobile+hotspot&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwil0vObpLzXAhXm1IMKHRRYBX4Q_AUIDSgE&biw=1440&bih=794

replies.body: I'd take the route Chermorg recommended here. Mobile hotspots aren't designed for online multiplayer gaming so it's likely to be a little iffy when playing League. Talking with your campus IT to see about getting some adjustments made for League specifically would be your best bet.

Your ping on a mobile hotspot in the US is probably going to be too high to play League efficiently. I’d recommend contacting your school’s IT department - most schools don’t block video game ports (they know college students like their games after all), so maybe it’s a setting issue.
